question: [File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_db_versions.rs] [Struct: Cmd] [Sharding Misconfiguration] Can the ShardingConfig be manipulated to access non-sharded databases with sharding enabled or vice versa, causing incorrect shard index calculations and reading state from wrong shards? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_db_versions.rs] [Function: Cmd::run() line 51] [Read-Only Flag Bypass] Is the readonly=true flag properly enforced by RocksDB, or could there be race conditions where write operations occur during debugging, causing database corruption or inconsistent reads? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_db_versions.rs] [Function: Cmd::run() line 52] [Cache Misconfiguration] Does setting max_num_nodes_per_lru_cache_shard=0 disable caching entirely, potentially causing performance issues or enabling timing attacks that reveal which database entries are frequently accessed? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_db_versions.rs] [Function: Cmd::run() lines 136-164] [Shard Iterator Safety] Can concurrent iterations over different shards cause race conditions or inconsistent reads if the database is being pruned simultaneously by another process? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_db_versions.rs] [Function: Cmd::run()] [Error Propagation] Do all database access operations properly propagate errors using Result<()>, or are there paths where errors are silently ignored, potentially hiding database corruption or access failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_raw_data_by_version.rs] [Function: Cmd::run() line 20] [Version Type Safety] Can the u64 version parameter overflow when used in database queries, potentially wrapping around to access version 0 or causing integer arithmetic errors in version calculations? [File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db_debugger/examine/print_raw_data_by_version.rs] [Function: Cmd::run() lines 32-39] [Database Opening] Does AptosDB::open_dbs() with readonly=true properly prevent write access, or could there be vulnerabilities where the debugging tool inadvertently modifies database state while inspecting it?
